boomSpecificDocs.title: Software Breaks
boomSpecificDocs.notes: The documents titled v1.03.190 apply to v1.03.190 - vx.xx.xxx

installSteps.contentHtml:
Equipment Technologies MY26 • Steel • 100ft • 15" • Lite

Machine: Equipment Technologies MY26

Boom: 81-nozzle boom @ 15" spacing

Hub: PinPoint III Lite Hub (Ports 1–4)

Section 1 – Prep & Verification

  • Install PowerHub using machine-specific mounting brackets or a universal mounting kit.
  • PowerHub mounting position: Mount PowerHub in the center. Orient hub with power lugs at the bottom.
  • If the power harness is installed, ensure the circuit breaker is tripped before continuing.
  • Confirm the boom on the machine matches the boom drawing (nozzle count, spacing, folds).
  • Flush/clean boom prior to valve install and confirm 80-mesh (or finer) strainers are installed.
  • Install all solenoid valves onto spray bodies across the boom.
  • IMPORTANT: Do not spin o-rings when installing Spitfire valves. Hold the coil stationary while tightening the flynut.
  • VCM orientation: mount with connectors facing the ground or perpendicular to the ground. Do not face connectors upward.
  • VCM orientation: keep the 12-pin DT connector labeled “Left 1-6” on the left and “Right 7-12” on the right.
  • Installer workflow: start at the leftmost boom tip and work left → right.

Section 2 – VCM Map (Mount + Valve Ranges)

Mount each VCM at the labeled position shown in the Boom Graphic.

VCM Port Valves Used 6-Drop Harnesses Dust Plugs CAN Terminator
1-1 1 1–12 12 2 0 Terminate VCM
1-2 1 13–24 12 2 0
2-1 2 25–36 12 2 0 Terminate VCM
2-2 2 37–45 9 2 3
3-1 3 46–57 12 2 0
3-2 3 58–69 12 2 0 Terminate VCM
4-1 4 70–81 12 2 0 Terminate VCM
  • Mounting: Mount each VCM at the labeled position shown in the Boom Graphic.
  • Nozzle Drop Harness Installation Rules: If a nozzle drop harness runs to the left of a VCM mounting position, plug it into the VCM 12-pin connector labeled Left 1-6. If it runs to the right of a VCM mounting position, plug it into the VCM 12-pin connector labeled Right 7-12.
  • Nozzle Drop Harnesses Note: During installation of nozzle drop harnesses, drops may be skipped to go around obstacles and fold joints.
  • Dust plugs: Install 2-pin Weatherpack dust plugs on all nozzle harness drops not plugged into a valve (see Dust Plugs column).

Section 3 – Extension Harness Table

Install extension harnesses per the Boom Graphic, use table as reference to boom graphic.

From To Length
VCM 1-2 VCM 1-1 20'
Hub (Port 1) VCM 1-2 30'
VCM 2-2 VCM 2-1 15'
Hub (Port 2) VCM 2-2 5'
Hub (Port 3) VCM 3-1 15'
VCM 3-1 VCM 3-2 20'
Hub (Port 4) VCM 4-1 45'

Best Practices

  • Do not overtighten zip ties.
  • Do not zip tie harnesses permanently until initial tests are completed.
  • If a harness is too long and must be coiled, do not overbend it (never tighter than the radius of a soda can).
  • Avoid routing over rough surfaces and sharp points.
  • Add additional protection in high-friction areas.
